meanings.sent1: The caterpillar undergoes a dimorphous transformation into a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: The plant has dimorphous leaves, some round and others long and narrow.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see the dimorphous clouds in the sky, one fluffy and the other wispy.
meanings.sent4: Her dimorphous personality made her both outgoing and reserved at the same time.
meanings.sent5: The dimorphous crystals sparkled differently under the sunlight, one side clear and the other opaque.

meanings.definition: Having two different shapes or structures.
meanings.sent1: The dimorphous rocks in the cave were smooth on one side and rough on the other.
meanings.sent2: The dimorphous building had a modern glass facade and a traditional brick back.
meanings.sent3: The dimorphous puzzle pieces fit together oddly, one side square and the other round.
meanings.sent4: His dimorphous artwork combined abstract shapes with realistic figures.
meanings.sent5: The dimorphous tree trunk twisted in two different directions, creating a unique shape in the forest.
